The schematic diagram shows a guide rail at an angle α with a ball in a groove, connected by a rope to a pillow held by a child.
Identify forces: The child and pillow system is subject to gravity and the tension in the rope; the ball is subject to gravity and the tension in the rope.
Use a coordinate system aligned with the incline of the guide rail.
Forces on the child and pillow: Total mass is \( m_1 + m_2 \); gravitational force is \( (m_1 + m_2)g \); component along incline is \( (m_1 + m_2)g \sin \alpha \).
Forces on the ball: Subject to gravity and tension; focus on tension since ball's mass is ignored.
Tension in the rope pulls the child and pillow down the incline and counteracts gravity's component along the incline.
Equilibrium condition: Since β is constant, system is in equilibrium perpendicular to the incline; tension \( T = (m_1 + m_2)g \cos \beta \).
Force exerted by the pillow on the child is the normal force due to the weight of the pillow, \( m_1 g \).
Calculate ratio: \( \frac{T}{m_1 g} = \frac{(m_1 + m_2)g \cos \beta}{m_1 g} = \frac{m_1 + m_2}{m_1} \cos \beta \).
Final answer: The ratio of the tension of the rope to the force exerted by the pillow on the child is \( \left(1 + \frac{m_2}{m_1}\right) \cos \beta \).
